definition[0]: a high-pressure job or situation is one in which you need to work very hard
definition[1]: containing or using a very high pressure or force of water, gas, air etc
definition[2]: a high-pressure job or situation is one where you need to work extremely hard
example[1]: He helped launch the television network and then left the high-pressure job after disagreements with a colleague.
definition[3]: very direct methods of selling that try to force people to buy
example[2]: They used high pressure sales tactics to force unwary customers to buy securities that were worthless.
